title: Ursa Major secures $100 million in new capital as it leans hard into defense work
summary:
The company now counts liquid engines for hypersonic vehicles and solid rocket motors as its core lines of business.

title: Eutelsat approves nearly $1 billion capital boost
summary:
Eutelsat is a step closer to the financing needed to refresh its OneWeb LEO broadband constellation, after the French operator’s board approved plans Nov. 18 to raise nearly $1 billion from anchor shareholders.
The post Eutelsat approves nearly $1 billion capital boost appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA Telescopes View Spiral Galaxy
summary: NGC 1068, a relatively nearby spiral galaxy, appears in this image released on July 23, 2025. The galaxy contains a black hole at its center that is twice as massive as the Milky Way’s. NASA’s Chandra X-ray Observatory data shows a million-mile-per-hour wind is being driven from NGC 1068’s black hole and lighting up the […]

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to resume early evening launches after FAA restrictions lifted
summary: The Starlink 6-94 mission is scheduled to liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station, Florida, at 7:12 p.m. EST (0012 UTC), carrying 29 satellites for SpaceX’s Starlink internet service.

title: The next generation of radar needed to detect micro-debris and enable a safer LEO
summary:
As someone deeply involved in the space sector, I’ve seen firsthand how low Earth orbit (LEO) is becoming increasingly congested. Satellite operators, space agencies and aerospace companies are all facing a growing threat from orbital debris. With more than 10,000 active satellites already in orbit and millions of smaller fragments accumulating, the risk of collision […]

title: Avoiding a harmful lunar ‘gold rush’
summary:
As shown by the recent SpaceNews editorials by Mustafa Bilal and Stirling Forbes, there is currently much talk of a coming lunar “gold rush,” with nations and companies seemingly in a mad scramble to access the moon for its alleged resources. title: ArianeGroup–Avio Deal Outlines Extended Transition of Turbopump Manufacturing to France
summary:
A new agreement between ArianeGroup and Avio has renewed questions about when the production of Ariane 6 turbopumps will be transferred from Italy to France. The transfer was intended to offset Vernon losing the responsibility for Vinci upper stage integration to Lampoldshausen in Germany, as agreed during the 2019 ESA Ministerial Council meeting in Seville.
